availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Newton Bowen (Powell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Powell County, Kentucky, farmer. Montgomery County, Kentucky, native. Son of Hezekiah Bowen and Mary Bowen. Married to Mary Ann Willis in Powell County, Kentucky, on November 29, 1859. Father of James A. Bowen, Lon E. Bowen, and Catherine Bowen. Resident of Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Powell County in 1860. Indicted for manslaughter of Henry T. Hall in the Powell Circuit Court in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 2, p. 48B-49A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, p. 15.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Powell County, Precinct 3, p. 148A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994053, Powell County Marriages, p. 283.
"Isaac Newton Bowen (1836-1915)," Find A Grave, Memorial #87631413, accessed January 25, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87631413.
